‎05-11-2010 08:41 AM

I wouldn;t try it now, but back in the bakery days I used to love dropping a banana in, and coating it with powdered baking chocolate...
Morris

Diagnosed Type 2, with an A1c of 11.4 in 2003; averaging a 5.0 A1c since then with diet, exercise and Glipizide XL + meds for blood pressure and cholesterol.  A bit dated, but scroll down on this page if you want to know more ...

‎05-11-2010 03:03 PM

Hi Big Red -- Your response was a cute one!

Lizzy-- Strawberries sound great in a dark chocolate fondue!
How about apples in a cheese fondue?

Morris -- As for bananas... my I make my DH (whole) bananas dipped in a mix of melted dark chocolate and natural peanut butter and then freeze them (in the warm weather). He loves those. I am not big on bananas, so I don't eat them. He is now testing his BG a few times a day and is trying to be careful, as both T1 and T2 run in his family. He is also being supportive to me right now... so maybe he will not be eating that frozen banana this summer?
His own meter readings may scare him away from this particular treat?

Oh, Lee? Where are you? We need your help! Just look at what has happened to all of us!

At T2 fork in the road I took the Right path

‎05-11-2010 04:32 PM

Due to LIGHTENING STORM last night I had to shut down completely my CPU!! All of this left path talk brought down the RATH......

I have just been sitting here thinking if it's ok for Lizzy, Red, Morris to go left then I can also. Opening and peeling down paper around my Family Size Snickers Bar (not nana) and reaching over to dip it into the Select Dark filled fondue pot (Morris provided)!! Hey Lizzy this left path stuff ain't bad, I was try'in to stay on the right path but...... not gonna meter after this snack!!

Promise me you'll always remember:
"You're Braver than you believe, Stronger that you seem, and Smarter than you think !"

Christopher Robin to Pooh Bear

Lee, T2 since 07/1988
Live long and prosper.

"Don't waste any tomorrows because of what you didn't do yesterday !"

Stop! Stop! Stop!

Stop all this talk about Snickers! Every week when I go grocery shopping I have to fight off the haunting song of the Snickers Sirens...(especially since they now have a Fudge Snickers bar...ya really gotta wonder if that tastes as decadent as it sounds...)
Today's subliminal message is:

Put me firmly in the "good dark chocolate" camp. Not that I eat very much of it any more (don't even crave it), but when I want some chocolate, nice, dark and European is the way forward. I love Green & Black's 72%..
